intro: Alcea freyniana, commonly known as the desert holly, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet to pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It serves as a valuable nectar source for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
